title: Job Vacancies at AXA Mansard Insurance Plc
content:
AXA Mansard is one of the foremost Financial Institutions in Nigeria, that has been offering world class financial services over the years.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Senior Data Analyst

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Senior Data Analyst will play a key role in scaling the Kampe Care initiative by providing actionable insights to drive decision-making and performance improvement.
	The analyst will manage and analyse data across pharmacies, telemedicine, claims, and enrolments to ensure quality, affordability, and sustainability of the Kampe model.
	This role will also ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, mentor junior analysts, and build a strong data-driven culture within the project team and partner ecosystem.


Key Responsibilities


	Consolidate and manage data from pharmacy partners, telemedicine platforms, insurance claims, and customer enrolments.
	Maintain data governance processes, documentation, and audit trails.
	Provide actionable insights to improve pharmacy performance, customer experience, and overall project outcomes.
	Build and maintain dashboards (Power BI, Tableau, or equivalent) for project KPIs such as enrolment growth, customer satisfaction, claims turnaround time, and system uptime.
	Collaborate with Operations, Technology, Finance, Compliance, and Pharmacy Network teams to understand data needs.
	Conduct forecasting and predictive analysis to estimate enrolment growth, service utilization, and pharmacy performance under scale.
	Mentor junior analysts and pharmacy data staff in tools, methods, and best practices.


Role Qualification
Academic/Professional:


	BSc / Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or related field (master’s degree a plus)


Work Experience:


	5-7 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or healthcare/insurance analytics.


Required Skills and Competencies:


	SQL, Power BI/Tableau, Excel (advanced), Python/R.
	ETL processes, data warehousing, and interoperability between partner systems.
	Healthcare/insurance KPIs: claims turnaround, POCT utilization, enrolment. retention, compliance metrics.
	Strong analytical and critical thinking skills


Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Project Manager - Kampe Care

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Project Manager will lead the successful transition of the Kampe Care initiative from pilot to scale.
	This role is responsible for coordinating cross functional teams, pharmacy partners, and technology/insurance stakeholders to ensure seamless execution of the Kampe scale-up strategy.
	The Project Manager will oversee planning, implementation, monitoring, and reporting to deliver on Kampe’s mission of providing quality, affordable, and accessible primary care through community pharmacies.


Key Responsibilities


	Coordinate across workstreams (Proposition, Technology, Operations) to achieve pilot-to-scale transition.
	Translate strategic objectives into actionable project plans and deliverables.
	Ensure execution within approved timelines, budgets, and scope.
	Track progress against project KPIs and adjust plans proactively to close gaps. Build strong working relationships with AXA Mansard, Drugstoc, and other partners.
	Oversee interoperability of enrolment, telemedicine, claims, and reporting platforms.
	Monitor accuracy, security, and timeliness of data capture and exchange across the ecosystem.
	Track and report on key system KPIs: uptime, data accuracy, and interoperability performance.
	Ensure adherence to medical protocols, clinical pathways, and pharmacy service standards.
	Facilitate alignment and communication with internal stakeholders and business units.
	Manage communication channels and governance forums to ensure collaboration and accountability.
	Ensure smooth integration of systems between partners.
	Monitor compliance with insurance regulations, health laws, and data privacy requirements.
	Work with legal, risk, and compliance teams to review contracts, manage partner agreements, and mitigate liabilities.
	Ensure pharmacies meet regulatory accreditation/certification requirements.
	Track and report on regulatory compliance incidents (target: zero tolerance).
	Oversee onboarding, certification, and training of pharmacies as Kampe providers.
	Ensure smooth integration of POCTs, telemedicine, and claims


Role Qualification
Academic/Professional:


	BSc / Degree in Project Management, Business Administration, Pharmacy,
	Public health, or any related field from a reputable Tertiary Institution.
	PMP, PRINCE2, or Agile/Scrum certification preferred.


Work Experience:


	8 - 10 years of experience in project management, preferably within insurance, public health, provider network, or digital project environments, will be an added advantage.


Required Skills and Competencies:


	Project Management Tools & Methodologies: Proficiency with MS Project,
	Jira, Asana, Trello, or similar; strong knowledge of Agile, Waterfall, and Hybrid approaches.
	Technology & Systems Integration
	Data & Reporting: Advanced skills in Excel, Power BI, or Tableau
	Healthcare/Insurance Knowledge


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Pharmacy Network Supervisor

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Pharmacy Network Supervisor will oversee field monitoring teams and ensure effective supervision of community pharmacies enrolled in the Kampe Care initiative.
	The role is accountable for ensuring that pharmacies comply with Kampe standards, deliver quality healthcare services, and provide excellent customer experience.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead and supervise Pharmacy Network Field Workers/Monitoring Officers across assigned regions.
	Review and validate reports from monitoring teams for accuracy and completeness.
	Escalate systemic issues, fraud risks, or high-risk incidents to the Head of Pharmacy Benefit and Project Manager.
	Liaise with central teams (Technology, Claims, Operations, Compliance) to resolve field-level issues.
	Develop action plans with monitoring teams to address performance or compliance gaps.
	Support management in implemen..ng mi..ga..on strategies across the network.


Role Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Pharmacy, Nursing, Public Health, Healthcare Administration, or related field (master’s degree is a plus).
	4-6 years of experience in healthcare supervision, provider relations, or field operations.
	Knowledge of healthcare regulatory requirements.


Required Skills and Competencies:


	Data collection validation and reporting (Excel, Power BI, or mobile data tools).
	Knowledge of network or pharmacy operations, primary care, and claims processes
	Strong communication and relationship-building skills.
	Ability to balance field realities with project targets.

  "description": "Brint Online School is a fast-growing global education brand providing world-class online learning for learners across Nigeria, the UK, US, Canada, and other countries.&nbsp;We&rsquo;re passionate about connecting great tutors with great learners &mdash; and we&rsquo;re building a world-class onboarding experience that reflects our values of excellence, empathy, and consistency.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Onboarding Specialist&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Remote&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Operations / Onboarding Unit

Job Summary


	We are now seeking an Onboarding Specialist to join our remote team &mdash; someone who can manage the full onboarding process for new tutors and learners, ensuring smooth transitions, clear communication, and great first impressions.
	The Onboarding Specialist will be responsible for welcoming, guiding, and activating new tutors and learners into the Brint system.
	They will ensure that everyone &mdash; parent, learner, or tutor &mdash; begins their journey confidently, informed, and excited to be part of the Brint community.
	This is a coordination and communication-heavy role that requires strong attention to detail, follow-up discipline, and people warmth.


Key Responsibilities
Tutor Onboarding:


	Coordinate the recruitment-to-activation process for tutors (documentation, training, and scheduling setup).
	Ensure all tutor data, documents, and onboarding forms are accurate and complete.
	Guide new tutors through Brint&rsquo;s policies, salary structure, and app tools.
	Schedule first classes, ensure class access, and confirm readiness before start date.
	Work with the Tutor Success Unit and HR to flag inconsistencies, incomplete onboarding, or missed trainings.


Learner Onboarding:


	Welcome new parents and learners warmly after registration/payment confirmation.
	Confirm learner details, subjects, time zones, and tutor assignments.
	Ensure the learner&rsquo;s class setup (Google Meet links, app access, WhatsApp groups, etc.) is correct and tested.
	Maintain regular updates with parents in the first 2 weeks of class to ensure satisfaction.
	Coordinate replacements or schedule adjustments in collaboration with Operations.


Systems &amp; Reporting:


	Update and maintain onboarding trackers (tutor, parent, learner).
	Send weekly onboarding reports to the COO and Chief of Staff.
	Identify and report patterns or bottlenecks in the onboarding process for system improvement.
	Suggest creative ways to improve Brint&rsquo;s onboarding experience (automations, communication templates, etc.).


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Education, Administration, Human Resources, or related fields.
	2&ndash;4 years of experience in onboarding, operations, or customer service (preferably in education or tech).
	Excellent written and spoken communication skills.
	Strong attention to detail, follow-up, and organization.
	Tech-savvy &mdash; comfortable with Google Workspace, WhatsApp Business, CRM tools, or scheduling software.
	Emotionally intelligent and professional when interacting with tutors, parents, and staff.
	Must be proactive, reliable, and able to work independently in a remote team.


Who You Are:


	You love creating smooth, efficient experiences for others.
	You&rsquo;re warm, patient, but extremely organized.
	You communicate clearly and professionally.
	You&rsquo;re comfortable managing multiple moving parts and deadlines.
	You take ownership and pride in doing things right the first time.


Why Join Brint


	Salary:&nbsp;N100,000 / month.
	Be part of one of Africa&rsquo;s fastest-growing global education brands.
	Work remotely with a collaborative, purpose-driven team.
	Help shape the first experience every tutor and learner has with Brint.


Why this range:


	N150k works for mid-level onboarding/operations specialists with solid admin and people skills.
	N180k attracts candidates with prior online school, edtech, or HR coordination experience &mdash; especially if they can handle both tutor and learner onboarding seamlessly.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a short cover letter explaining their onboarding or education operations experience to:&nbsp;recruitments@brintsschool.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Application &ndash; Onboarding Specialist (Remote)&rdquo; as the subject of the email.",

	Guide new tutors through Brint’s policies, salary structure, and app tools.
	Schedule first classes, ensure class access, and confirm readiness before start date.
	Work with the Tutor Success Unit and HR to flag inconsistencies, incomplete onboarding, or missed trainings.


Learner Onboarding:


	Welcome new parents and learners warmly after registration/payment confirmation.
	Confirm learner details, subjects, time zones, and tutor assignments.
	Ensure the learner’s class setup (Google Meet links, app access, WhatsApp groups, etc.) is correct and tested.
	Maintain regular updates with parents in the first 2 weeks of class to ensure satisfaction.
	Coordinate replacements or schedule adjustments in collaboration with Operations.


Systems & Reporting:


	Update and maintain onboarding trackers (tutor, parent, learner).
	Send weekly onboarding reports to the COO and Chief of Staff.
	Identify and report patterns or bottlenecks in the onboarding process for system improvement.
	Suggest creative ways to improve Brint’s onboarding experience (automations, communication templates, etc.).


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Education, Administration, Human Resources, or related fields.
	2–4 years of experience in onboarding, operations, or customer service (preferably in education or tech).
	Excellent written and spoken communication skills.
	Strong attention to detail, follow-up, and organization.
	Tech-savvy — comfortable with Google Workspace, WhatsApp Business, CRM tools, or scheduling software.
	Emotionally intelligent and professional when interacting with tutors, parents, and staff.
	Must be proactive, reliable, and able to work independently in a remote team.


Who You Are:


	You love creating smooth, efficient experiences for others.
	You’re warm, patient, but extremely organized.
	You communicate clearly and professionally.
	You’re comfortable managing multiple moving parts and deadlines.
	You take ownership and pride in doing things right the first time.


Why Join Brint


	Salary: N100,000 / month.
	Be part of one of Africa’s fastest-growing global education brands.
	Work remotely with a collaborative, purpose-driven team.
	Help shape the first experience every tutor and learner has with Brint.


Why this range:


	N150k works for mid-level onboarding/operations specialists with solid admin and people skills.
	N180k attracts candidates with prior online school, edtech, or HR coordination experience — especially if they can handle both tutor and learner onboarding seamlessly.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a short cover letter explaining their onboarding or education operations experience to: recruitments@brintsschool.com using “Application – Onboarding Specialist (Remote)” as the subject of the email.
